figures.title: Brain Emulation Pipeline
figures.description: Overview of the brain emulation pipeline showing the key stages from neural data acquisition through to computational simulation and embodied behavior.

figures.title: LLM vs Brain Emulation Pipelines
figures.description: Side-by-side comparison of Large Language Model training pipelines (data science, machine learning) versus Brain Emulation Model pipelines (neural dynamics, connectomics, computational neuroscience).

figures.title: Mouse to Digital Twin
figures.description: Conceptual illustration of transforming a biological mouse into its digital emulation, showing the transition from organic to computational representation.

figures.title: Structure to Function Pipeline
figures.description: The brain emulation pipeline from neural dynamics and connectomics through to computational neuroscience, showing how structural data (connectome) combines with functional data to enable simulation, embodiment, and behavior.

figures.title: C. elegans Multiple Connectomes
figures.description: Illustration of multiple C. elegans connectomes, showing the complete neural wiring diagrams of several individual nematodes.

figures.title: C. elegans Original Connectome
figures.description: Illustration of the original C. elegans connectome, the first complete neural wiring diagram of any organism.

figures.title: Drosophila Brain and Ventral Nerve Cord
figures.description: Anatomical illustration of the Drosophila melanogaster brain and ventral nerve cord (VNC), showing the complete central nervous system.

figures.title: Drosophila Half Brain
figures.description: Anatomical illustration of one hemisphere of the Drosophila melanogaster brain.

figures.title: Drosophila Ventral Nerve Cord
figures.description: Anatomical illustration of the Drosophila melanogaster ventral nerve cord (VNC), the insect equivalent of the spinal cord.

figures.title: Drosophila Whole Brain
figures.description: Anatomical illustration of the complete Drosophila melanogaster brain, showing both hemispheres.

figures.title: Human Brain
figures.description: Anatomical illustration of the human brain, representing the most complex known neural structure.

figures.title: Larval Zebrafish Brain
figures.description: Anatomical illustration of the larval zebrafish brain, a key model organism for whole-brain imaging studies.

figures.title: Larval Zebrafish Spinal Cord
figures.description: Anatomical illustration of the larval zebrafish spinal cord.

figures.title: Mouse Brain
figures.description: Anatomical illustration of the mouse brain, a primary mammalian model organism for neuroscience research.

_instructions.note: Add your hand-drawn figures to this folder as PNG and SVG pairs (e.g., figure-name.png and figure-name.svg)

fields.id: Unique identifier for the figure (use lowercase with hyphens)
fields.title: Display title for the figure
fields.description: Brief description of what the figure shows
fields.filename: Base filename without extension (e.g., 'neuron-diagram' for neuron-diagram.png/svg)
fields.organism: Array of organism tags: all, c-elegans, drosophila, zebrafish, mouse, rat, human, mammalian, silicon
fields.type: Array of type tags: hand-drawn, plus any relevant: overview, simulation, recording, anatomy, etc.
